protected abstract banking.Receipt completeTransaction() throws atm.physical.CustomerConsole.Cancelled;
properties.description: Completes the final step of an ATM transaction by processing the actual banking operation and generating a receipt.
properties.howItWorks: As an abstract method, this defines a contract for subclasses to implement transaction completion logic. When invoked, it should perform the final banking operations (such as updating account balances, dispensing cash, or transferring funds) and return a transaction receipt. The method can throw a CustomerConsole.Cancelled exception if the user cancels the transaction during completion.
properties.howToUse: This method is called by performTransaction() after initial validation and user input. Subclasses implement this method to handle specific transaction types (withdrawal, deposit, transfer, etc.) and must return a properly formatted Receipt object.
postConditions: A banking.Receipt object is returned
The underlying transaction state is finalized
Any necessary account balance updates have been performed
If cancellation occurs, a CustomerConsole.Cancelled exception is thrown
preConditions: Transaction has been properly validated
User has provided all required inputs
Sufficient funds/resources are available for the transaction
properties.returns: A banking.Receipt object containing details of the completed transaction

The class manages source/destination accounts and transfer amounts, interacts with customers through menu interfaces, creates banking messages for transaction processing, and produces formatted transaction receipts.

properties.description: Synchronously read user input from the keyboard simulation with specified mode and validation constraints.
properties.howItWorks: The method sets up input parameters including mode and maximum value, clears previous input, and configures display echo based on the input mode (showing "0.00" for amount mode or empty string for other modes). It requests keyboard focus and then waits synchronously for user interaction. Once the wait completes, it resets the mode to idle and returns either the collected input string or null if the input was cancelled. The synchronized keyword ensures thread-safe operation during the wait/notify cycle.
properties.howToUse: This method is called by simulation components to block and wait for user keyboard input with specific validation rules. The calling thread will be blocked until the user provides input or cancels. The mode parameter controls display formatting, with AMOUNT_MODE showing currency format and other modes showing standard text input.
postConditions: The keyboard focus has been requested and released
The mode has been reset to IDLE_MODE
Current input buffer is cleared for next use
Display echo has been configured based on input mode
preConditions: The SimKeyboard instance is properly initialized and has a valid display component
The method is called from a context where blocking wait is acceptable
SetEcho method is available and functional
properties.returns: The collected user input as a String, or null if the input operation was cancelled by the user.

properties.description: Create and configure a GridBagConstraints object with specified positioning, sizing, and layout properties for GUI component placement.
properties.howItWorks: This static method creates a new GridBagConstraints instance and sets its properties including grid position (row, col), dimensions (width, height), fill behavior, insets, weight distribution, and anchor position. The method returns a fully configured constraint object ready for use in GridBagLayout.
properties.howToUse: Called by GUI components to obtain properly configured GridBagConstraints without repetitive setup code. Parameters specify the component's grid position and sizing requirements.
properties.postConditions: Returns a GridBagConstraints object with all properties set to the specified values plus default insets (2,2,2,2), weight values (1,1), and center anchor position.
properties.preConditions: All parameters should be valid integers. The fill parameter should be one of the valid GridBagConstraints fill values.
properties.returns: A fully configured GridBagConstraints object ready for use in GridBagLayout to position and size GUI components.

properties.docComment:
Animate dispensing cash to a customer

@param amount
		the amount of cash to dispense
		
		Precondition: amount is <= cash on hand
properties.description: Animates the cash dispensing process by displaying the monetary amount with a pulsating font size effect, creating a visual simulation of cash being dispensed from an ATM.
properties.howItWorks: The method takes a Money object parameter and sets the text of a UI label to its string representation. It then creates a visual animation effect by iterating through font sizes from 3 to 24 points, making the label visible for 250 milliseconds at each size before hiding it again. This creates a pulsating effect that simulates the physical act of cash being dispensed from an ATM machine.
properties.howToUse: Call this method to provide visual feedback during cash dispensing operations. Pass the monetary amount being dispensed as the parameter. The method will block for approximately 5.25 seconds (21 iterations × 250ms) while the animation plays.
postConditions: The label's text is set to the string representation of the monetary amount
A pulsating font size animation is executed with sizes ranging from 3 to 24 points
The animation creates visual feedback that mimics the physical dispensing of cash from an ATM
The method completes after approximately 5.25 seconds of animation
preConditions: The this.label reference must be initialized and not null
The amount parameter must not be null
The method should be called from the Event Dispatch Thread (EDT) to avoid UI freezing issues
properties.returns: No return value (void method). The method performs visual animation and updates UI components in place.

Manager for the ATM's card reader.  In a real ATM, this would 
 manage a physical device; in this simulation, it uses classes 
 in package simulation to simulate the device.
properties.description: The CardReader class in the atm.physical package serves as a component for managing card-related operations in an ATM system. It provides methods for reading cards, ejecting cards, and retaining cards through delegation to a simulation engine. The class maintains a reference to its parent ATM and acts as an intermediary between the physical card reader hardware and the underlying simulation system, abstracting the actual implementation details of card processing operations.

properties.description: Delegate user input reading to the underlying keyboard simulation
properties.howItWorks: This method acts as a simple delegation wrapper that forwards the readInput request to the internal keyboard object (SimKeyboard). It passes through both the mode parameter (which controls display formatting and validation rules) and maxValue parameter (used for validation constraints). The method returns whatever String result the keyboard.readInput method provides, which could be the user input or null if cancelled.
properties.howToUse: This method is called by ATM physical components (CustomerConsole) when they need to capture user input. The calling components pass a mode constant (such as AMOUNT_MODE for currency display or other modes for standard text) and optionally a maxValue for validation. The method blocks until user provides input or cancels, then returns the input String or null.
preConditions: The keyboard field must be initialized with a valid SimKeyboard instance
Mode must be one of the valid input mode constants defined by the system
postConditions: Returns the user input as a String if input was provided
Returns null if user cancelled the input operation
The calling thread remains blocked until user provides input or cancels
properties.returns: User input as a String, or null if the input operation was cancelled by the user

Animate card going into the machine
properties.description: Animates the visual insertion of a card by progressively shrinking the card reader component while keeping it centered, creating a realistic insertion effect.
properties.howItWorks: The method stores the original bounds of the component and creates a working copy. In a loop, it gradually reduces the height by 1 pixel while proportionally decreasing the width to maintain the aspect ratio. The component remains centered by calculating new x and y coordinates. After each adjustment, it updates the component's bounds, repaints the display, and sleeps for 100ms to create a smooth animation. When the component dimensions reach zero, it becomes invisible.
properties.howToUse: Call this method to visually demonstrate a card being inserted into the card reader. It should be invoked after the card insertion process is initiated, typically from the readCard() method in the Simulation class.
postConditions: The card reader component becomes invisible
The animation has completed, creating a visual insertion effect
The original bounds are stored for potential restoration
preConditions: The component must have valid bounds defined
The method should be called from the UI thread or have proper thread synchronization
properties.returns: void - No return value

properties.docComment: Handle the ENTER key
properties.description: Handle enter key press events by processing input based on current keyboard mode and coordinating thread communication
properties.howItWorks: The method uses a switch statement to handle different keyboard modes (IDLE_MODE, PIN_MODE, AMOUNT_MODE, MENU_MODE). For PIN_MODE and AMOUNT_MODE, it checks if current input exists - if so, it calls notify() to wake waiting threads; otherwise it plays a beep sound. For IDLE_MODE, it performs no action. For MENU_MODE, it only plays a beep sound. The synchronized keyword ensures thread-safe access to shared state.
properties.howToUse: This method should be called by the keyboard event handler when the enter key is pressed during ATM simulation. It automatically handles the appropriate response based on the current state of the keyboard input system.
postConditions: If in PIN_MODE or AMOUNT_MODE with valid input, a waiting thread will be notified
If in PIN_MODE or AMOUNT_MODE with empty input, a beep sound is played
If in MENU_MODE, a beep sound is played
If in IDLE_MODE, no action is taken
The method maintains thread safety through synchronization
preConditions: The method must be called on an instance that has been properly initialized with a valid mode
The currentInput field must be accessible and contain the current user input string
The instance must have access to a valid Toolkit for beep functionality
If in PIN_MODE or AMOUNT_MODE, the currentInput field should reflect the current state of user input
properties.returns: void

properties.description: Handles ATM power state changes and card reader visibility based on switch state
properties.howItWorks: Sets the card reader's visibility to match the input switch state. If the switch is turned on, it activates the ATM by calling switchOn(). If the switch is turned off, it deactivates the ATM by calling switchOff(). This method serves as a central control point for managing the ATM's operational state and associated UI components.
properties.howToUse: Call this method whenever the operator switch changes state, passing true to power on the ATM and false to power it off. This method should be invoked by UI components that monitor switch changes on the operator console.
preConditions: The method expects a valid boolean value
The atm object must be properly initialized
The cardReader object must be properly initialized
postConditions: Card reader visibility is set to match the switch state
ATM is powered on when switch is true
ATM is powered off when switch is false
properties.returns: void

properties.docComment:
Create a string representation of this amount

@return string representation of this amount
properties.description: Converts the monetary value stored in cents to a formatted currency string with dollar sign and proper decimal notation.
preConditions: The object must have a valid 'cents' field representing a monetary amount
The 'cents' field should be a non-negative integer value
postConditions: Returns a string formatted as currency with dollar sign
Decimal portion always shows two digits (e.g., '.05' for 5 cents)
No trailing spaces or additional characters are included
properties.returns: A string representation of the monetary value in USD format (e.g., "$10.50", "$5.05")
properties.howItWorks: The method divides the cents by 100 to get the dollar amount, then calculates the remainder for cents. It uses a ternary operator to handle the decimal formatting - if the cents remainder is 10 or greater, it displays it directly; if less than 10, it adds a leading zero. The final format concatenates "$" + dollars + "." + cents (with proper zero-padding for single-digit cents).
properties.howToUse: This method is automatically called when the Money object needs to be converted to a string representation, commonly used for display purposes, logging, or concatenation with other strings. No parameters are required as it operates on the current object instance.

properties.description: Process bank account balance inquiry by validating account access and populating balance information for the specified card and account type.
properties.howItWorks: Extracts the card number from the message, retrieves the corresponding account number from a mapping table, validates the account exists, and if valid, populates the balances object with total and available amounts from internal balance arrays. Returns success or failure status based on account validation.
properties.howToUse: Called when processing balance inquiry requests from ATM transactions. Pass a Message containing card and account information, and a Balances object to be populated with the current account balances.
postConditions: balances object contains current account balance data if account is valid
Returns Failure status if account number is invalid (0)
Returns Success status if balance inquiry completed successfully
preConditions: Message must contain a valid card with number
Message must specify a valid account type
ACCOUNT_NUMBER mapping must be initialized
properties.returns: Banking Status indicating success or failure of the inquiry operation

Exception thrown when the user presses the cancel key while the ATM is

This class extends a base exception or result class, providing a standardized way to communicate that an operation was cancelled by the customer. It encapsulates the cancellation reason as "Cancelled by customer" and serves as a specific type that calling code can catch and handle to manage user flow after cancellation.

Representation for the ATM itself.  An object of this class "owns"
 the objects representing the component parts of the ATM, and the
 communications network, and is responsible for creating customer 
 sessions which then use it to gain access to the component parts.
 This is an active class - when an instance of the class is created,
 a thread is executed that actually runs the system.
properties.description: The ATM class serves as the central coordinator and controller for the entire ATM simulation system. It manages all physical components (card reader, cash dispenser, receipt printer, network connection, etc.), controls the main state machine with three operational states (OFF, IDLE, SERVING_CUSTOMER), and orchestrates system startup, shutdown, and transaction processing workflows. The class provides controlled access to all ATM physical components through accessor methods and coordinates between different subsystems during customer interactions.

properties.docComment: Representation for a balance inquiry transaction
properties.description: The Inquiry class represents a specific type of ATM transaction for account balance inquiries. It extends the abstract Transaction class and implements the complete workflow for inquiry operations, including getting account selection from the customer and generating formatted receipts with balance information. The class handles the transaction-specific logic for balance inquiries while delegating common transaction management to the parent Transaction class.

properties.docComment: Handle the CLEAR key
properties.description: Clears the current keyboard input and updates display feedback based on the current simulation mode, handling different behaviors for PIN entry, amount entry, menu navigation, and idle states.
properties.howItWorks: The method is synchronized to prevent concurrent access during input clearing operations. It uses a switch statement to handle different keyboard modes: in IDLE_MODE it does nothing, in PIN_MODE it clears the current input buffer and sets the display echo to an empty string, in AMOUNT_MODE it clears the input but sets the echo to "0.00" as a default amount display, and in MENU_MODE it plays a beep sound to provide audio feedback to the user. The method delegates display updates to the setEcho() method for proper UI synchronization.
properties.howToUse: This method is called internally by the SimKeyboard class when the clear/enter key is pressed during ATM simulation. It automatically handles the appropriate clearing behavior based on the current interaction mode, providing appropriate visual and audio feedback to guide user interactions.
preConditions: The method must be called within a synchronized context to prevent race conditions
The SimKeyboard instance must be properly initialized with a valid mode state
The currentInput buffer must be accessible and in a valid state for clearing operations
The display component must be available for echo text updates
postConditions: The currentInput buffer is cleared (length set to 0) for PIN_MODE and AMOUNT_MODE
The display echo is updated appropriately based on the current mode (empty string for PIN_MODE, '0.00' for AMOUNT_MODE)
A beep sound is played in MENU_MODE for user feedback
No state changes occur in IDLE_MODE
All operations maintain thread safety through synchronization
properties.returns: void - this method doesn't return any value as its purpose is to perform side effects on the keyboard state and display

properties.description: Prints all lines of a receipt by iterating through its content and delegating the actual printing to the simulation engine.
properties.howItWorks: The method receives a banking.Receipt object and retrieves an Enumeration of all receipt lines using getLines(). It then iterates through each line using hasMoreElements() and nextElement(), and for each line it obtains the singleton Simulation instance and calls printReceiptLine() to simulate the physical printing process. This follows a delegation pattern where the ReceiptPrinter coordinates the printing but delegates the actual printing logic to the simulation engine.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when a receipt needs to be printed, passing a valid banking.Receipt object containing the lines to be printed. The method will handle the complete printing process automatically, including obtaining the simulation instance and printing each line sequentially.
preConditions: The receipt parameter must not be null
The receipt must contain lines to print (getLines() should return a non-empty enumeration)
postConditions: All receipt lines have been printed to the simulation
The simulation state reflects that a receipt has been printed
properties.returns: void

This follows the template method pattern where the base Receipt class handles common receipt formatting while the subclass provides transaction-specific details.

properties.description: The GUI class in the simulation package serves as the main user interface coordinator for the ATM simulator. It manages the overall user interface flow by coordinating between multiple panels (ATMPanel, BillsPanel, CardPanel, LogPanel) using a CardLayout. The class handles user interactions for card reading, cash initialization, and logging operations. It acts as a central controller that delegates UI operations to specific panels and provides methods for displaying different views, managing layout constraints, and facilitating communication between the user and the underlying ATM simulation components.

properties.description: Control the main ATM state machine by continuously running an event loop that manages three states (OFF, IDLE, SERVING_CUSTOMER), handling transitions between states based on user interactions and system conditions.
properties.howItWorks: The method implements an infinite loop that acts as the main event dispatcher for the ATM system. It uses a switch statement to handle three states: 1) OFF_STATE - displays unavailability message and waits for system activation, 2) IDLE_STATE - prompts for card insertion and waits for user input, 3) SERVING_CUSTOMER_STATE - delegates to Session object to perform the actual ATM transaction workflow. Synchronized wait() calls allow the method to block until specific events (system activation, card insertion) occur. State transitions occur automatically based on the current state and triggered conditions.
properties.howToUse: This method should be called as the main entry point to start the ATM system operation. It runs continuously and handles all state transitions automatically. The calling thread will block indefinitely as this method contains an infinite loop. Ensure all ATM components (customer console, session manager) are properly initialized before invoking this method.
postConditions: ATM is in one of the three states: OFF_STATE, IDLE_STATE, or SERVING_CUSTOMER_STATE
If in OFF_STATE, system is waiting for activation and displays unavailability message
If in IDLE_STATE, system prompts for card insertion and waits for user interaction
If in SERVING_CUSTOMER_STATE, an active Session object is processing customer transactions
preConditions: ATM object is properly initialized with all required components
customerConsole reference is valid and functional
switchOn and cardInserted flags are properly initialized
Session class is available for instantiation when needed
properties.returns: void - This method runs continuously in an infinite loop and never returns normally.

properties.description: Dispense cash to a customer by reducing available funds, triggering visual simulation, and logging the transaction.
properties.howItWorks: The method performs three sequential operations: (1) It subtracts the requested amount from the CashDispatcher's internal cashOnHand tracker, (2) It calls the simulation engine's dispenseCash method which handles the visual cash dispensing animation while blocking the caller for approximately 5.25 seconds, and (3) It records the dispensing event in the transaction log through the logCashDispensed method. These operations ensure the physical cash tracking, visual feedback, and audit trail are all maintained consistently.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when a customer has requested a cash withdrawal and the ATM has verified sufficient funds are available. The method requires no additional setup as it manages all aspects of the cash dispensing process internally, including state updates, visual feedback, and logging.

properties.description: The banking package contains core domain model classes and abstractions for an ATM simulation system. It includes value objects (Money, Balances), data transfer objects (Message, Card), abstract base classes for status outcomes and receipts (Status, Receipt), and centralized account metadata (AccountInformation). These classes represent fundamental banking concepts and provide structured data containers for the application's business logic, without implementing UI, data access, or core business operations themselves. The package serves as a foundation for the banking system's domain layer, defining the essential data structures and abstractions that encapsulate the ATM simulation's core banking entities and their relationships.

properties.description: Represents a withdrawal transaction in an ATM system, extending the abstract Transaction class to provide specialized handling for cash withdrawal operations. The class manages the complete withdrawal workflow including customer input collection for account selection and withdrawal amount, validates cash availability, dispenses physical currency, and generates transaction receipts. It encapsulates withdrawal-specific business logic while delegating common transaction framework functionality to its parent Transaction class.

properties.description: Creates and returns the appropriate transaction object based on user menu selection, factory method for transaction instantiation
properties.howItWorks: This static factory method creates transaction objects by first prompting the user to select a transaction type from a menu via the ATM's customer console. It then uses a switch statement to instantiate the appropriate Transaction subclass (Withdrawal, Deposit, Transfer, or Inquiry) based on the user's zero-based menu choice. Each transaction is initialized with the provided ATM, session, card, and PIN parameters. properties.description: Handle envelope insertion simulation with visual feedback and timeout mechanism
properties.howItWorks: The method initializes by resetting the insertion state and making the envelope acceptor component visible. It then waits for either a maximum time period or until an envelope is inserted (indicated by the inserted flag being set to true). If insertion occurs, it performs a visual animation by progressively shrinking the component's bounds to simulate envelope consumption, then hides the component. If no insertion occurs within the timeout period, it simply hides the component. The method returns a boolean indicating whether an envelope was successfully inserted.
properties.howToUse: This synchronized method should be called when the ATM simulation needs to prompt the user to insert an envelope. The calling thread will be blocked until either the envelope is inserted or the maximum wait time expires. The returned boolean indicates the success of the envelope insertion operation.

properties.description: Transfers money between two bank accounts, performing validation checks and updating account balances accordingly.
properties.howItWorks: The method validates the source and destination accounts by checking the ACCOUNT_NUMBER lookup table, ensures the accounts are different, and verifies sufficient available balance. Upon successful validation, it subtracts the transfer amount from the source account's total and available balances, adds the amount to the destination account's balances, updates the provided Balances object with the destination account's new values, and returns a success status. If any validation fails, it returns an appropriate failure status with a descriptive error message.
properties.howToUse: This method is called internally by the bank's message handler to process transfer requests. It requires a valid Message object containing card details, account identifiers, and transfer amount, along with a Balances object to update with the destination account's new balance values.
properties.postConditions: If validation succeeds, source account balances are reduced by the transfer amount, destination account balances are increased by the same amount, and the balances parameter is updated with destination account values. A Success status is returned. If validation fails, a Failure status with appropriate error message is returned and no account balances are modified.
properties.preConditions: The Message object must contain a valid card with existing account associations in ACCOUNT_NUMBER table. The transfer amount must be a positive Money object.
properties.returns: A banking.Status object, either Success if the transfer completed successfully or Failure with an error message if validation failed.

properties.description: The atm package serves as the central coordination and control hub for the entire ATM simulation system. It contains the core ATM and Session classes that orchestrate all ATM operations, manage state machines, and coordinate between physical device components and transaction processing. The package implements the main workflow control for customer interactions, including card processing, PIN verification, transaction execution, and system state management. It provides the primary interface and coordination logic that brings together the physical device abstractions in atm.physical with the business logic in atm.transaction to create a complete ATM simulation experience.
properties.title: ATM System Coordinator Package

properties.description: Manages the invalid PIN extension process by allowing up to 3 PIN re-entry attempts, validating each with the bank, and retaining the card if all attempts fail
properties.howItWorks: The method iterates up to 3 times, each time reading a new PIN from the customer, sending it to the bank for validation, and checking if it's valid. If a valid PIN is entered, it sets the session PIN and returns the success status. After 3 failed attempts, it triggers card retention as a security measure, displays a warning message, and throws a CardRetained exception. The method coordinates customer console interactions, bank network communication, and session management.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when a customer enters an invalid PIN during transaction processing. The method will handle the complete invalid PIN extension flow including customer re-entry prompts, bank validation, and card retention if necessary. properties.description: Returns an Enumeration that provides sequential access to all lines of a receipt, organized in three portions: heading, details, and balances.

It uses a two-level iteration strategy: tracking the current portion (heading, details, or balances) with a 'portion' variable and an index within each portion. The enumeration returns lines in sequence, advancing portions when one section is exhausted. The Enumeration maintains state across hasMoreElements() and nextElement() calls.

properties.description: The atm.physical package manages all physical ATM device components and hardware interfaces. It provides a comprehensive abstraction layer for ATM physical devices including the operator panel, network connection to banking systems, receipt printer, envelope acceptor, logging system, customer console, card reader, and cash dispenser. Each class serves as a manager/facade for a specific physical device, delegating actual operations to simulation engine classes while providing clean interfaces for the ATM application. The package also includes utility classes like CustomerConsole$Cancelled for handling user interaction exceptions. This design allows the ATM simulation to maintain realistic device behavior without requiring actual physical hardware, making it suitable for testing, training, and development purposes.
properties.title: ATM Physical Device Management

properties.description: Manages the complete ATM customer session workflow using a state machine pattern, coordinating card reading, PIN verification, transaction selection and execution, and card ejection.
properties.howItWorks: Implements a state-driven session controller that transitions through ATM operational states: reading card, PIN verification, transaction selection, transaction execution, and card ejection. Uses a switch statement to handle each state, coordinating with ATM components (CardReader, CustomerConsole) and transaction objects. Handles exceptions and cancellations by routing to appropriate next states. The session continues until a final state is reached or a card is retained due to security violations.
properties.howToUse: Called by the ATM main controller to initiate a complete customer interaction session. The method blocks until the session completes and handles all customer interactions automatically. Ensure ATM components are properly initialized before calling this method.

properties.returns: A banking.Money object representing the initial cash amount, calculated as 20 times the number of bills entered by the user.

properties.docComment: Animate ejecting the card that is currently inside the reader.
properties.description: Animates the visual ejection of a card from the card reader by gradually scaling and positioning the component to simulate a card being ejected.
properties.howItWorks: The method starts by setting a status label to "Ejecting card" and making the component visible. It creates a starting rectangle with minimal size (1 height) at the center of the original bounds, then uses a while loop to incrementally increase the rectangle's dimensions while keeping it centered. Each iteration updates the component's bounds, forces a repaint, pauses for 100ms to create smooth animation, and recalculates positioning to maintain centering. The animation continues until the component reaches its original dimensions. Finally, it updates the label to "Click to insert card" to indicate completion.
properties.howToUse: Call this method to trigger the visual animation when a card needs to be ejected from the card reader. The method handles all visual aspects of the ejection animation and updates the UI state accordingly.
properties.preConditions: The component should be part of a GUI and have valid originalBounds set. This method should be called from the event dispatch thread to avoid UI concurrency issues.
properties.postConditions: The component will be visible and returned to its original size and position. The label will be updated to "Click to insert card". The method will complete after the animation finishes.
properties.returns: void

properties.howItWorks: The method is called when a card retention event occurs. It first triggers an animation on the card reader component to visually indicate that a card has been retained, then re-enables the operator panel to allow further ATM operations.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when the ATM system needs to retain a card, such as after detecting a confiscated card or security event. The method handles both the visual feedback and operational state changes.
preConditions: The cardReader component must be initialized and available
The operatorPanel component must be initialized and available
A card retention event has been detected by the system
postConditions: The card retention animation has been triggered on the card reader
The operator panel is enabled for further operations
The system state reflects that a card retention has occurred
properties.returns: void - no return value

properties.docComment:
Simulation of the physical components of the ATM, including its network 
 connection to the bank.  An instance is created at startup by either the
 application's main() program or the applet's init() method.

 The individual components are displayed in a panel belonging to class GUI.
 The bank is simulated by an object belonging to class SimulatedBank.  The
 constructor for this class creates one instance of each.

 The static method getInstance() allows components of the ATM to access the one
 and only instance of this class in order to simulate various operations.  The
 remaining methods simulate specific operations of the ATM, and are forwarded
 to either the GUI panel or the simulated bank to actually carry them out.
properties.description: The Simulation class serves as the central coordinator of the ATM simulation system, managing and orchestrating all simulation components including the simulated bank, ATM hardware components (card reader, cash dispenser, display, keyboard, receipt printer, envelope acceptor), operator panel, and GUI interface. It implements the Singleton pattern to provide global access to the simulation engine and delegates work to appropriate components while maintaining the overall simulation state and lifecycle.
Initialize CardReader with ATM dependency injection
properties.howItWorks: This constructor takes an ATM object as a parameter and assigns it to the instance field. It first calls the superclass constructor using super(), then stores the provided ATM reference for use by other methods in the CardReader class. This establishes the relationship between the CardReader component and its parent ATM system.
properties.howToUse: This constructor is called when creating a new CardReader instance. Pass a valid ATM object that represents the ATM system this card reader is part of. The constructor ensures the CardReader has access to the broader ATM context it operates within.
postConditions: CardReader instance is properly initialized
ATM reference is stored and accessible to other CardReader methods
CardReader is ready to perform card reading operations within the ATM context
preConditions: A valid ATM object must be provided as parameter
ATM object should represent a properly initialized ATM system
properties.returns: A newly created and initialized CardReader instance

properties.description: Initialize the OperatorPanel with a reference to the ATM system
properties.howItWorks: This constructor creates a new instance of OperatorPanel. It first calls the superclass constructor using super(). Then it stores the provided ATM reference in the atm instance field, establishing a dependency relationship that allows the OperatorPanel to interact with the broader ATM system.
properties.howToUse: Call this constructor when creating a new OperatorPanel instance, passing a valid ATM object as the parameter. The constructor establishes the necessary connection between the operator panel and the ATM system.
postConditions: The atm field is initialized with the provided ATM reference
The OperatorPanel instance is fully constructed and ready for use
preConditions: The atm parameter must not be null
A valid ATM instance must be available
properties.returns: A newly created and initialized OperatorPanel instance

properties.docComment: Representation for one ATM session serving a single customer.
properties.description: The Session class manages the complete ATM customer interaction workflow through a state machine controller. It coordinates card reading, PIN verification, transaction selection and execution, and card ejection processes. The class maintains session state, PIN information, and ATM reference while directing the flow between different operational states using defined state constants. It serves as the central coordinator for ATM user sessions, handling all customer interactions from card insertion to session completion.

Based on the boolean result from the simulation, it either logs the successful envelope acceptance using the log component or throws a Cancelled exception to indicate the operation was aborted by the customer.

properties.howItWorks: The constructor initializes a GridBagLayout manager for the panel and systematically adds each ATM component with specific positioning constraints. It wraps certain components (card reader, envelope acceptor) in intermediate Panel containers for proper layout management. A "Show Log" button is created with an ActionListener that calls gui.showCard("LOG") to display the application log. Some components like the envelope acceptor are initially set to invisible state.

All ATM simulation components are added to the panel with correct positioning

It performs no additional initialization logic beyond what the parent class constructor provides. The CustomerConsole class inherits all properties and behavior from its parent class, with this constructor serving as the default instantiation point. No additional setup, validation, or configuration occurs during construction.

properties.description: Initialize a multi-line display panel for an ATM simulation with green background, white text, and monospaced font
properties.howItWorks: The constructor first calls the parent class constructor, then configures the panel's layout using a GridLayout with a number of rows defined by ATMPanel.DISPLAYABLE_LINES and 1 column. It sets a dark green background color (RGB 0,96,0) and white foreground color. A monospaced font is created with size 14. The constructor allocates an array of Label components based on the same DISPLAYABLE_LINES constant, then iterates through each line to create a new Label, initialize it with a blank display line, apply the monospaced font, and add it to the panel. Finally, it initializes the currentDisplayLine counter to 0.
properties.howToUse: This constructor is called when creating a new SimDisplay instance, typically during ATM interface initialization. The SimDisplay object will manage multiple lines of display text for the ATM simulation interface.

Exception that is thrown when the customer's card is retained due to too
 many invalid PIN entries
properties.description: A custom exception class that represents the specific error condition of ATM card retention due to excessive invalid PIN attempts. This class extends the exception hierarchy to provide meaningful error handling in the ATM transaction system, encapsulating the business rule that cards should be retained after multiple failed authentication attempts. The class provides a constructor that initializes the exception with a predefined error message describing the card retention reason.

Manager for the ATM's receipt printer.  In a real ATM, this would

properties.description: The ReceiptPrinter class is responsible for printing receipts in the ATM simulation. It serves as a coordinator between the receipt data and the physical printing simulation, iterating through receipt content and delegating the actual printing operations to the simulation engine. The class provides a clean interface for printing receipts while abstracting the complexity of the physical printing process through delegation to the singleton Simulation instance.

properties.description: Collects customer input for withdrawal transaction details including account selection and amount, validates cash availability, and returns a withdrawal message.
properties.howItWorks: The method first displays a menu to select the account type (checking, savings, etc.) and then presents predefined withdrawal amounts ($20, $40, $60, $100, $200). It validates each amount selection by checking if the ATM has sufficient cash on hand. If the requested amount is not available, it displays an error message and prompts again. The method continues looping until a valid amount is selected, then returns a banking.Message object containing the withdrawal request details including account, amount, card, and PIN information.
properties.howToUse: Call this method during withdrawal transaction processing when customer input is needed to specify transaction parameters. The method will block waiting for user input and may throw a Cancelled exception if the user aborts the operation. Handle the Cancelled exception appropriately in the calling code.

It configures the panel's font to monospaced style and adds multiple Label components displaying ATM simulation instructions about magnetic card readers and manual card number entry. A TextField is created for card number input and an ActionListener is attached to handle Enter key presses by notifying any waiting threads. The TextField is housed within a Panel container before being added to the main CardPanel.

properties.description: Delegates the card insertion event from the simulation to the ATM component by calling its cardInserted() method.
properties.howItWorks: This method implements a simple delegation pattern where it receives a card insertion event and forwards it to the underlying ATM object. The method takes no parameters and returns void, serving as a clean interface between the simulation's card reader component and the ATM core functionality. When invoked, it simply calls this.atm.cardInserted(), which handles the actual business logic of processing the card insertion event.
properties.howToUse: This method should be called by simulation components (such as SimCardReader) when a card insertion event occurs in the simulated environment. It serves as a bridge between the simulation layer and the ATM business logic, ensuring that simulation events are properly communicated to the ATM system for processing.
properties.postConditions: The ATM's cardInserted() method is successfully invoked, propagating the card insertion event through the system.
properties.preConditions: The Simulation object must have a valid ATM reference (this.atm) that is properly initialized and ready to process card insertion events.
properties.returns: void - no return value as this method solely serves to delegate the event.

properties.description: The simulation package serves as the primary user interface layer for the ATM simulator, providing comprehensive UI components that simulate all aspects of an ATM interface including display, keyboard, card reader, cash dispenser, envelope acceptor, and receipt printer. The package coordinates multiple specialized UI panels (ATMPanel, BillsPanel, LogPanel, CardPanel) using a CardLayout system and provides both visual simulation and user interaction handling for the complete ATM experience. It also includes the Simulation class as a central coordinator managing all components and the SimulatedBank class for transaction processing, while maintaining authentic ATM visual appearance with proper styling and animations.

It calculates the padding needed to center the echo text by taking a substring of the blank display line and concatenating the echo string. The padding is determined by taking half the length of the blank display line minus the length of the echo string, creating a centered appearance.

properties.description: Converts a Message object to a formatted string representation containing operation type, card number, transaction details, account information, and amount.
properties.howItWorks: The method uses a switch statement to map message codes to operation type strings, then builds a comprehensive string by appending card number, transaction serial number, conditionally adding from/to account information based on their values, and conditionally adding amount information only if the amount is greater than zero. The final formatted string represents the complete message details for logging or display purposes.
properties.howToUse: Call this method on any banking.Message instance to get a human-readable string representation of the message. The method requires no parameters and is automatically used by Java's string concatenation and System.out.println operations.

The returned string includes operation type, card number, transaction number, account details, and amount if applicable
String format is consistent and suitable for logging or display purposes

The card field must not be null and must have a valid card number
The serialNumber field must be set
The amount field must be initialized
properties.returns: A formatted string containing the complete message details including operation type, card number, transaction number, account information, and amount (if greater than zero).

properties.description: Displays multi-line text by tokenizing input and setting text on display line components
properties.howItWorks: The method takes a text string, tokenizes it using StringTokenizer with newline delimiter, and iterates through each token. For each token, it sets the text on the corresponding displayLine array element using the currentDisplayLine index. It catches and silently ignores any exceptions that occur during this process. The method maintains state through currentDisplayLine which gets incremented with each line processed.
properties.howToUse: Call this method with a String containing text to be displayed. Multi-line text will be automatically split by newline characters and distributed across available display lines. Exception handling is built-in but silent.
properties.postConditions: Display lines are updated with text from the input string, split by newlines. currentDisplayLine is incremented for each token processed.
properties.preConditions: displayLine array must be initialized and currentDisplayLine must be valid index
properties.returns: void - no return value

properties.description: Forward banking messages to the simulated bank with network delay simulation
properties.howItWorks: The method implements a message forwarding mechanism that simulates real-world network communication delays. It first introduces a 2-second delay using Thread.sleep() to mimic the time it takes for messages to travel through banking networks. The method then delegates the actual message processing to the simulated bank's handleMessage method, which validates the message and routes it to appropriate handlers for different ATM operations. This creates a realistic simulation environment where physical ATM components interact with banking logic through a simulated network layer.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when processing ATM transactions that require communication with the banking system. Pass a valid Message object containing card details and operation type, along with a Balances object to be updated. The method will simulate network delay and return a Status object indicating the result of the banking operation.
postConditions: Network delay simulation is completed
Banking message is processed by simulated bank
Status object is returned indicating operation success or failure
Balances object is updated with current account information
preConditions: Message object must be properly initialized with valid card and operation data
Balances object must be provided for updates
Simulated bank instance must be available and initialized
properties.returns: A banking.Status object indicating the result of the banking operation - either Success, Failure with reason, InvalidPIN, or status from delegated operation handlers

properties.description: Validates banking messages and routes them to appropriate handler methods for different ATM operations.
properties.howItWorks: The method performs two-level validation: first checking if the card number is within valid range, then verifying the PIN matches the stored value. If validation fails, it returns appropriate error statuses. Upon successful validation, it uses a switch statement to dispatch the message to the appropriate handler method based on the message code: withdrawal, initiate deposit, complete deposit, transfer, or inquiry operations.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when processing ATM transactions to validate and route banking messages to their appropriate handlers. Pass a valid Message object containing card details and operation type, along with a Balances object to be updated. The method will return a Status object indicating success or failure of the operation.
preConditions: Message object must not be null
Message must contain a valid Card object
Card must have a valid card number
PIN must be provided in the message
Balances object must not be null
postConditions: Returns a banking.Status object indicating success or specific failure reason
If validation fails, returns Failure or InvalidPIN status without processing operation
If validation succeeds, delegates to appropriate handler method and returns its result
Does not modify balances unless operation completes successfully

properties.description: Concrete implementation of banking.Status for representing successful banking operations in the ATM simulation. This nested class provides standardized methods to check operation success, validate PIN status, and retrieve success messages. It serves as a simple data holder for successful transaction outcomes, always returning true for success checks and false for invalid PIN checks, while providing access to optional success messages.

properties.description: Display a prompt and read a monetary amount from the customer through the simulation interface, returning it as a Money object or throwing Cancelled if the user cancels the operation.
properties.howItWorks: The method coordinates with the simulation engine to provide a user interface for inputting monetary amounts. It first clears the display and shows the provided prompt followed by an empty line. It then reads user input in AMOUNT_MODE using the simulation's input system. After clearing the display again, it processes the input by parsing it as an integer, dividing by 100 to get dollars and using modulo 100 to get cents. The parsed values are used to construct and return a new Money object. If the user cancels the input operation (returning null), it throws a Cancelled exception.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when you need to prompt the customer for a monetary amount. Pass a descriptive prompt string that will be displayed to guide the customer. The method will block until the customer enters an amount or cancels. Handle the Cancelled exception in calling code if the operation might be cancelled by the user. The returned Money object can be used directly in banking operations.

properties.description: Complete a deposit transaction by accepting an envelope and sending completion message to bank
properties.howItWorks: The method orchestrates the final steps of a deposit transaction. First, it calls the envelope acceptor to physically collect the deposit envelope from the customer. Then it constructs and sends a COMPLETE_DEPOSIT message to the bank through the network connection, including the card details, PIN, transaction serial number, target account, and amount. Finally, it creates and returns a detailed receipt for the transaction, using an anonymous inner class that extends the Receipt class to provide deposit-specific details like the account abbreviation and deposited amount.
properties.howToUse: This method is called internally by the deposit transaction flow after the customer has confirmed the deposit details and is ready to complete the transaction. The method blocks while waiting for envelope acceptance and may throw a Cancelled exception if the operation times out or is cancelled by the customer. The returned Receipt object can be displayed to the customer or printed as documentation of the completed transaction.

properties.description: Converts the Status object to a string representation based on its current state, returning descriptive status indicators for success, invalid PIN, or failure scenarios.
properties.howItWorks: The method checks the current status state by calling three getter methods in sequence. First, it checks if the status represents success using `isSuccess()` and returns "SUCCESS" if true. If not successful, it then checks if the status represents an invalid PIN using `isInvalidPIN()` and returns "INVALID PIN" if true. For all other failure cases, it returns "FAILURE" concatenated with the descriptive message obtained from `getMessage()`. This provides a hierarchical status representation that prioritizes success, then specific failure types, then general failures with context.
properties.howToUse: Invoke this method on any Status object to get a human-readable string representation of the current status. The method requires no parameters and can be used for logging, debugging, or displaying status information to users. It's automatically called when the Status object is used in string contexts or concatenated with strings.

These operations are executed sequentially to ensure the ATM has the necessary cash reserves and network connectivity before beginning normal operations.

properties.description: Initializes and launches the ATM simulation application by creating the main components (ATM instance, simulation, and GUI), setting up the user interface with menu systems, and starting the ATM processing thread while displaying the main application window.
properties.howItWorks: The method follows a typical Java application entry point pattern. It first creates an ATM object with predefined parameters (ID 42, location "Gordon College", bank "First National Bank of Podunk"). Then it creates a Simulation object that wraps the ATM. For the GUI, it creates a Frame, adds the simulation's GUI component, and sets up a menu system with File->Quit functionality. It starts the ATM as a separate thread for concurrent operation and makes the main frame visible with proper sizing.

properties.description: Initializes the ATM simulation by creating ATM and Simulation objects, starting the ATM thread, and setting up the graphical user interface by adding the simulation's GUI panel to the applet.
properties.howItWorks: The method performs a multi-step initialization process: 1) Creates an ATM object with specific identifiers (ID 42, institution "Gordon College", bank "First National Bank of Podunk"), 2) Wraps the ATM in a Simulation object for coordinated control, 3) Starts the ATM on a separate thread for concurrent operation, 4) Retrieves the GUI panel from the simulation, 5) Configures the applet's background to match the GUI, 6) Adds the GUI panel to the applet for display.
properties.howToUse: This method is called automatically by the Java applet framework during initialization. It requires no parameters and sets up the entire ATM simulation environment. The method should be called before any interaction with the simulation is possible.

properties.docComment:
Manager for the ATM's operator panel.  In a real ATM, this would 
 manage a physical device; in this simulation,  it uses classes 
 in package simulation to simulate the device.
properties.description: The OperatorPanel class serves as a bridge component between the ATM system and the operator interface. It manages the relationship with the main ATM system through composition and provides services for initial cash amount retrieval through delegation to the simulation engine. The class handles operator interaction during ATM initialization and maintains the connection to the broader ATM simulation framework.
Handle digit key input from ATM keyboard based on current mode (IDLE, PIN, AMOUNT, or MENU), updating display echo and state accordingly
properties.howItWorks: The method operates as a state machine handler for digit input. It checks the current mode (IDLE, PIN, AMOUNT, or MENU) and processes the digit accordingly. In PIN mode, it appends digits to currentInput and displays asterisks for security. In AMOUNT mode, it formats the input as a monetary value. In MENU mode, it validates the digit range and notifies waiting threads. IDLE mode ignores the input.
properties.howToUse: This method is called by the ATM simulation framework when a digit key is pressed on the virtual keyboard. The caller provides the numeric value of the pressed key (0-9), and the method handles the appropriate response based on the current operation mode.
postConditions: Display shows appropriate echo text for the current mode
Current input buffer is updated with the digit when in PIN, AMOUNT, or MENU mode
In MENU mode, notification occurs if digit is valid
Audio feedback is provided for invalid menu selections
preConditions: Method is called with a digit value between 0-9
SimKeyboard instance has been properly initialized with a valid mode
Display component is available for echo updates
properties.returns: void - this method doesn't return any value, it only updates internal state and display

properties.docComment: Clear the simulated display
properties.description: Clear the display by delegating to the display object's clearDisplay method.
properties.howItWorks: This method simply delegates the display clearing responsibility to the display object by calling its clearDisplay() method. It acts as a wrapper method that provides a clean interface for clearing the entire display in the simulation context.
properties.howToUse: Call this method when you need to clear the entire display, such as when transitioning between different ATM screens, resetting the interface, or preparing for a new transaction display. The method requires no parameters and should be called when the display field is properly initialized.
postConditions: The display is completely cleared of all text
The display line counter is reset to zero
preConditions: The display field must be properly initialized and not null

properties.description: Constructs and initializes the operator panel UI component with button controls and message display for ATM simulation management.
properties.howItWorks: The constructor initializes the UI layout using BorderLayout, sets background color, and creates three main components: a west label titled "Operator Panel", a center message label showing current state instructions, and an east button panel with an ON/OFF button. It attaches an ActionListener to the button that toggles between ON/OFF states, updates the message text accordingly, and calls simulation.switchChanged() to notify the simulation of state changes. A background thread is also started to automatically hide the message when conditions are met (either when the button shows "OFF" or when the panel is disabled).
properties.howToUse: This constructor is called when creating a new SimOperatorPanel instance, passing a Simulation object as parameter to enable communication between the UI and the simulation logic.

This constructor must be called on the Event Dispatch Thread (EDT) for proper UI initialization

The background thread is started and running
The simulation object can receive switch change notifications

properties.description: The CustomerConsole class provides the user interface functionality for ATM customer interactions. It serves as an intermediary between the ATM application and customers, handling all user input/output operations through a simulation interface. The class manages monetary amount input, PIN entry, menu selection, and message display, coordinating with the Simulation engine to provide a complete customer console experience. It handles user interactions like reading amounts, collecting PINs, presenting menu options, and displaying information while properly managing cancellation scenarios.

properties.description: Handles cancellation request by notifying waiting threads to resume execution
properties.howItWorks: The method is a synchronized public void that calls Java's built-in notify() method on the current object instance. This is part of a wait/notify pattern where the method serves as a signal to wake up any threads that are currently waiting on this object's monitor lock.
properties.howToUse: Called when a cancellation request is initiated in the envelope acceptor simulation. Typically invoked by other parts of the system to signal that an ongoing operation should be cancelled and waiting threads should be awakened.
properties.postConditions: Any threads waiting on this object's monitor will be notified and can resume execution. The synchronization state of the object remains unchanged.
properties.preConditions: The method requires that the current thread holds the object's monitor lock (enforced by synchronized keyword). Any waiting threads must have previously called wait() on the same object.
properties.returns: void

properties.description: Create a new Money object by copying the monetary value from another Money object

It first calls the superclass constructor, then copies the cents field value from the provided Money object to the new instance. This ensures the new object has identical monetary value to the original.

properties.howItWorks: The method extracts card and account information from the message, validates the account type, checks daily withdrawal limits against remaining limit, verifies sufficient available balance, and if all validations pass, updates the withdrawal tracking, account balance, available balance, and returns success status. If any validation fails, it returns an appropriate failure status.

properties.description: Process a deposit transaction by validating the account, updating the balance, and returning transaction status
properties.howItWorks: The method validates the target account by retrieving the account number from the card and account type. If the account is invalid (account number is 0), it returns a Failure status. Otherwise, it adds the deposit amount to the account balance using the Money.add() method. The method then updates the provided Balances object with the new total balance while preserving the available balance, and returns a Success status.
properties.howToUse: This method should be called by bank message handlers to process deposit operations. It requires a valid Message containing card details and deposit amount, along with a Balances object to update. The method handles all validation and balance updates internally, returning appropriate success/failure status.
postConditions: Account balance is increased by the deposit amount if account is valid
Balances object is updated with new total balance

properties.description: Interacts with the customer to gather transfer details including source account, destination account, and transfer amount through menu selections and amount input, then creates and returns a banking message containing the transfer information.
properties.howItWorks: The method operates in three sequential steps to collect customer input: 1) It prompts the customer to select the source account from available account types using a menu interface, 2) It prompts the customer to select the destination account using another menu interface, 3) It prompts the customer to enter the transfer amount through a monetary input interface. After collecting all required information, it constructs and returns a banking.Message object containing the transfer type, card information, PIN, serial number, source account, destination account, and amount. The method handles user cancellation through the CustomerConsole.Cancelled exception, allowing users to abort the transaction at any input stage.
properties.howToUse: This method is called during a transfer transaction when the ATM needs to collect specific transfer details from the customer. The calling code should be prepared to handle the Cancelled exception, which indicates the user has chosen to abort the transfer operation. The returned Message object contains all necessary information for processing the transfer and should be passed to the banking system for execution.

The customer must have inserted a card and be authenticated
The transaction must be in a state where customer input collection is appropriate
Customer console must be able to display menus and prompts to the user
postConditions: The from, to, and amount instance variables are set with customer-entered values
A banking.Message object is created and returned containing all transfer details
If the customer cancels at any input stage, a Cancelled exception is thrown
The customer's input collection is completed successfully unless cancelled
properties.returns: A banking.Message object containing transfer transaction details including transaction type (TRANSFER), card information, PIN, serial number, source account, destination account, and transfer amount.

Main program class for the application version of the ATM simulation.

properties.description: The ATMMain class serves as the application bootstrap and main coordinator for the ATM simulation system. It initializes all core components including the ATM instance, simulation wrapper, and GUI framework, sets up the user interface with menu systems, and manages the main application lifecycle by starting the ATM processing thread and displaying the main application window. The class follows a typical Java application entry point pattern, creating a seamless launch experience for users while orchestrating the interaction between the simulation logic and user interface components.

Manager for the ATM's cash dispenser.  In a real ATM, this would

properties.description: The CashDispenser class manages the physical cash inventory and dispensing operations for an ATM simulation. It maintains tracking of available cash funds, provides cash dispensing functionality with visual simulation feedback, checks cash availability for withdrawal requests, and logs all dispensing activities for audit purposes. The class encapsulates the core logic for physical cash handling including state management, conditional dispensing based on available funds, and integration with logging systems.

The method provides read-only access to the total balance information stored in the Balances object. No complex calculations or business logic is performed - it simply exposes the encapsulated data.
properties.howToUse: Call this method on a Balances instance to retrieve the current total amount. The method requires no parameters and returns a Money object representing the total balance.

Returns a non-null banking.Money object if total has been initialized

It handles user interactions through action listeners and communicates state changes back to the main simulation object. The class also manages automatic message hiding through background threading to improve user experience.

properties.description: The ATMPanel class serves as the main user interface coordinator for the ATM simulation, managing the layout and integration of all ATM components (display, keyboard, cash dispenser, card reader, envelope acceptor, receipt printer) using a GridBagLayout system. It contains layout constants for positioning components and provides a centralized panel that combines multiple simulation components into a cohesive user interface, including a "Show Log" button for application logging.

properties.description: Initiate the cash dispensing simulation process
properties.howItWorks: This method serves as a delegation point for cash dispensing operations in the simulation. It receives a Money amount and forwards it to the cashDispenser component's animateDispensingCash method. The method itself contains no business logic or validation - it purely acts as a conduit to trigger the visual cash dispensing animation. When called, it immediately delegates the entire operation to the cashDispenser object, which handles the actual animation, UI updates, and timing (approximately 5.25 seconds of blocking animation).
properties.howToUse: Call this method when cash needs to be dispensed in the simulation. Pass the monetary amount to be dispensed as the parameter. The method will trigger the visual animation but will not return until the animation completes, effectively blocking the caller for about 5.25 seconds while the cash dispensing visualization plays out.
postConditions: The cash dispensing animation has been initiated and will run to completion
The method will block until the animation finishes (approximately 5.25 seconds)

The amount parameter represents a valid monetary value
The simulation environment supports UI animation

The method serves as a centralized logging interface for the physical ATM components to record envelope acceptance events in the simulation system's log panel.

Inherits from banking.Status abstract base class and serves as a concrete implementation for representing error conditions in ATM operations. Provides standardized access to failure messages and implements status checking methods like isSuccess() and isInvalidPIN(). Acts as a base class for more specific failure types like InvalidPIN in the banking simulation system.

properties.description: The CardPanel class serves as a specialized user interface component for ATM card number input in the ATM simulator. It creates and manages a GUI panel containing instructional labels and a text field for manual card number entry, with integrated action handling for user interactions. The class provides thread-safe methods to collect and validate card numbers from users, serving as a critical bridge between the user and the ATM simulation system's card processing functionality.

properties.docComment: Representation for customer's ATM card
properties.description: The Card class serves as a simple data container that encapsulates card number information. It provides a basic POJO structure for representing banking cards with a single integer field for the card number and a getter method for controlled access to that data.

properties.docComment: Asking if customer wants to do another transaction

Representations of a message from the ATM to the bank.
 Messages to the bank use a fixed format with fixed slots, not all of which
 pertain to any given type of transaction.  Each type of transaction creates
 one or more subclasses using the slots that it needs, and supplying appropriate
 "not needed" values for the rest.
properties.description: The Message class serves as a data transfer object that encapsulates all essential information for banking transactions in an ATM simulation system. It holds transaction details including account identifiers, monetary amounts, PIN verification data, card information, and message codes that distinguish between different transaction types (withdrawals, deposits, transfers, inquiries). The class provides controlled access to this sensitive banking data through getter methods and a setter for PIN updates, while maintaining encapsulation of internal state. It also includes functionality to format transaction information as a human-readable string for logging and display purposes.

properties.docComment: Handle the CANCEL KEY
properties.description: Handles cancel key press events by notifying waiting threads or envelope acceptor based on current operation mode
properties.howItWorks: Uses a switch statement to determine the current operation mode. In IDLE_MODE, it synchronizes on the envelopeAcceptor and calls notify() to wake up any waiting operations. In PIN_MODE, AMOUNT_MODE, or MENU_MODE, it sets the cancelled flag to true and calls notify() to interrupt ongoing operations. The synchronized keyword ensures thread-safe access.
properties.howToUse: This method is called internally by the SimKeyboard class when the cancel key is pressed on the ATM interface. It automatically handles the appropriate cancellation logic based on the current operation state.
properties.postConditions: For IDLE_MODE: envelopeAcceptor is notified. For other modes: cancelled flag is set to true and waiting threads are notified.
properties.preConditions: The method must be called with the current mode set to one of the valid states (IDLE_MODE, PIN_MODE, AMOUNT_MODE, or MENU_MODE). The object must be in a state where cancellation is a valid operation.
properties.returns: void

properties.description: Initialize a SimKeyboard component by setting up the keyboard layout, creating digit and function buttons with appropriate styling, configuring event listeners for both mouse and keyboard input, and establishing the initial state for ATM simulation input handling.
properties.howItWorks: The constructor sets up a 5x3 grid layout for the keyboard component. It creates numeric digit buttons (0-9) arranged in standard phone keypad format, with dedicated ENTER, CLEAR, and CANCEL function buttons. Each button receives specific color styling and action listeners that call corresponding methods (digitKeyPressed, enterKeyPressed, clearKeyPressed, cancelKeyPressed). Additionally, it sets up a KeyListener to handle physical keyboard input, mapping key codes and characters to the appropriate input methods. The constructor initializes the current input buffer and sets the keyboard mode to IDLE.
properties.howToUse: This constructor is called when creating a new SimKeyboard instance for the ATM simulator. Pass references to the SimDisplay and SimEnvelopeAcceptor components that the keyboard will interact with. The constructor automatically creates the visual interface and event handling infrastructure, making the keyboard ready for user input processing.
postConditions: The keyboard component is fully initialized and visible with all buttons laid out in a 5x3 grid
All digit buttons (0-9) and function buttons (ENTER, CLEAR, CANCEL) are created and properly styled
Action listeners are attached to all buttons, routing events to appropriate handler methods
A KeyListener is attached to handle physical keyboard input with proper key mapping
The keyboard is in IDLE mode with an empty input buffer, ready to process user input
preConditions: Valid SimDisplay and SimEnvelopeAcceptor references are provided
The component is being instantiated within a suitable GUI container with AWT support
properties.returns: No return value as this is a constructor that initializes the SimKeyboard instance
